# Answer in my observation
## Task 1
- Part of certifcate that indicates the CA's certificate is: `Version`, `Serial Number`, `Issuer`, `Subject` and `Validity`.
- If `Issuer` and `Subject` section has the same values, the certificate is a self-signed one.
- Here's the value of `n`, `q`, `e` value in private key:
+ Public Exponent `e` = 65537

+ Private Exponent `d` = 

+ Modulus `n` = 

+ Prime number `p` = 

+ Prime number `q` = 

&rarr; `n = p * q`

## Task 4
- When accessing to `http://www.bank32.com` I access to the website with `RED` background color and `Hello, world!`.
- When accessing to `https://www.bank32.com` I access to the website with `GREEN` background color and `Hello, world!`.
